intro.p: A new study published in the Journal of the American Academy of Child and Adolescent Psychiatry examined the effect of taking micronutrients for children with ADHD and emotional dysregulation. Researchers enrolled {{n}} children ages 6 to 12 years who had been diagnosed with ADHD and had at least one impairing irritability symptom in the study. The children were randomly enrolled into one of two groups, a group that received a micronutrient supplement (taken as 9 to 12 capsules per day with food) and a placebo group. Clinicians, who {{blinding}} who was receiving the supplement and who was receiving the placebo, rated the children on a range of behavioral scales both through direct observation and through interviews with parents. {{results}}.

outtro.p: The subjects that were given the placebo

content.p: Did the researchers use any blinding? If so, what was blinded
Are the results generalizable to all children with ADHD and emotional dysregulation? Explain your answer.
